data: In November, in the year 1836, the steamer “Royal Sovereign” took her departure from the foggy coast of Falmouth, lashing the waves with her paddle-wheels, and spreading her sails, gray and wet, in the mist still grayer and more wet than they.
Caballero, Fernán, 1796-1877; Starr, J. Leander (John Leander), 1802- [Translator]
